lIBZ2nPuXI3ei_o6zifiGA.text: Yet another new Nandos visit in a different country. Ate the hot pot which is a local twist on Nandos menu. Ofcourse the rest of the usual stuff like peri chips, etc

OYbCGUB5FYHeIQTyKODN-w.text: Some of the best grilled chicken I've had, but the side of rice was terrible and was basically white rice with vegetables that look like they came out of a frozen packet.The hot sauces are not very spicy. I recommend mixing the extra hot sauce with their wild herb sauce to get a good amount of heat and after kick. Come for the chicken, but pass on the sides.

rWa8vy27GbY_psaBILxVPg.text: Eating at Nandos made me realize that good food need not be complicated. You just need a tasty, well seasoned chicken, some flavored rice and some wild sauces. Aside from the great food, their staff was still pleasant and attentive with our requests despite the fact that we came in 30 minutes before closing time. I'm so in love with their sauces! It's a good thing they have it here in our local supermarket. I'm making a mental note to include it in my grocery list soon.

QhG2Z1URjTDuwIFRqgEMhw.text: Worst Nandos on the planet.  I live in the US so I never get it at home.  Excited to see it here but completely disappointed. Don't go

_etUyasIirWte3I8YuZHTA.text: Worst nando's ever been. Waited 30 mins for the first dish. Starter came after main. Terrible. Too hungry to write reviews.

xAWzlvcGItv2jspmQK1W9A.text: Terrible service! Slow and unfriendly staff, half our meal came out after 20 minutes, after 20 more minutes the first half of the meal was cold and the rest had still not arrived. Getting any attention from the staff took another 15 mins.  When we finally did manage to get someone to come to our table (by going to the kitchen area and interrupting the staff chatting amongst themselves while ignoring their customers), it turns out they had completely forgotten the second half of our meal. By this point we were happy to just leave. Their offer to not charge us for our pot of tea as compensation for half a meal being delivered and the other half being completely cold while we waited for the rest did not go down well! Disgusting service, do yourself a favour and avoid this Nandos.

x5vfQU6paHeoluW02jS1Og.text: Food is ok. Chicken was moist and not over cooked. Service was lousy. Slow and inattentive. There are better options in the area.

XYW0bZINoD2V5vPN0tlNJQ.text: Having tried the Nandos in Australia and London, I have high standards for this chain. It is disappointing that Singapore has decided to market it as a proper restaurant rather than the fast food/casual dining concept overseas. The Katong branch was disappointing with the chicken too dry and flavours lacking, but upon hearing good things about the Bugis Junction branch, I decided to give it another shot. The chicken comes in various flavours ranging from mild to extra hot, and my usual order of extra hot  piece chicken with peri peri chips was a very good comparison to the ones I've had in Australia. The meat was succulent, even with breast meat, and the peri peri sauce was flavourful and sufficient. The peri peri chips were good too, although more peri peri salt wouldn't have hurt. Overall, I the food was good, but unfortunately, at the end of the day it's still much better overseas and cheaper too.

lIng3t1xo2up9BuvAXbtKQ.text: Good food. The starter came with the main dish. Friendly staff. Liked music and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken breast with sweet potatoes and hummus as starter

-Xcrz_oDUZI0lf5XZ3-OzQ.text: Walking past Nando's was always accompanied by a glimpse of mouth-watering chicken glistening in its famous peri-peri sauce. Food-wise, the chicken pita I ordered was average with nothing much to rave about. In fact, the chicken was on the dry side instead of the juicy chunks I was expecting. However, its mild peri-peri sauce deserved a thumbs up. The balance of herbs mixed with just the right amount of spiciness was perfect as an accompaniment to alleviate the filling of the pita. Each bite of the veggies has a lingering smokey aftertaste that leaves you craving for another bite. Although not the best i've had, Nando's is worth a try as a quick fix for cravings for smokey flavours. But do take note that service levels at the JCube branch are not quite satisfactory. The branch was severely understaffed and somewhat not attentive. Waving frantically when they looked vaguely in our direction was probably the only way to get their attention. Definitely not the most ideal, but forgivable for a heartland mall I guess.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Singapore, Singapore. Pita

AFRNC0jjqUOvrEHl1CjTXA.text: Maybe we came on a rare good night and have the blissful ignorance of not having visited their apparently cheaper and better overseas locations, but we had an awesome, filling meal here for about $60. The chicken was well seasoned and flavorful. The chicken breast slices that came with the salad were perfect compared to the half chicken which was a little on the burnt side. The mashed sweet potatoes, corn on the cob, and salad were all excellent. My girlfriend said it was now one of her favorite restaurant at the end of the meal.

A8WO0L1xeLRroc4OxJCHug.text: The chicken was exquisite, the sauces and side dishes, a delight; but the service was out such a low and unhappy level that diluted the dining experience entirely! I can tolerate being ignored, but profoundly dislike sourness in service. Be prepared to be assertive, don't expect to be looked after, don't be afraid to ask twice or more for what you need!

9wMSuRumtyQkdAcI2cCplw.text: Good veggie wrap, nice, moist, juicy veggies and of course the Cora hot peri peri sauce! Very average on the hummus and pita, wouldn't order that again.

hyWs-uilH8tAJ8f_SDnG4w.text: If you've had Nando's in Australia, you would know they are famous for their grilled chicken with peri-peri sauce. In Singapore you can find the exact same offering however at a much higher price. Nando's over here offers table service but with poor standards service and guess what, water is chargeable! The chicken here in Singapore is really dry and under seasoned. Honestly it gives first timers a bad impression of a brand that actually serves up really good grilled chicken!
